Pre-Game Insights: India will aim to build on the momentum with an eye on the semi-final race.
All-rounder Hardik Pandya, who suffered from cramps towards the end of Pakistan match, is 'alright and fit to play'.
India bowling coach Paras Mhambrey confirmed that no player would be rested for the match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The weather forecast in Sydney is better with less chances of rain interruption.
India had an optional training session on Tuesday in the lead-up to the match against Netherlands.
India will meet Netherlands in their second match of the T20 World Cup at Sydney Cricket Ground on Thursday (October 27).
Others: The India bowling coach Paras Mhambrey stated that all players are in form and there is no need to rest anyone.
The match between India and Netherlands will begin at 12:30 PM IST at Sydney Cricket Ground.
